meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I stript the old wallpaper from the walls.

meanings.sent3: The mischievous wind stript the leaves off the trees in a playful dance.

meanings.sent5: The magician stript away the illusion to reveal the truth beneath.

meanings.definition: to remove clothing or covering from

meanings.sent2: After a long day at work, she stript off her uncomfortable shoes.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy stript the blanket off the bed and ran around the house with it.

meanings.sent5: The sun stript the snow from the mountaintop, revealing the lush greenery beneath.

meanings.definition: to deprive or strip of possessions or rights
meanings.sent1: The cruel ruler stript the villagers of their land and homes.
meanings.sent2: The thief stript the museum of its most valuable artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon stript the campsite of all its food supplies.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis stript many families of their savings and security.
meanings.sent5: The dictator stript the citizens of their freedom, imposing strict rules and regulations.
